utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: This is straight out of a slasher flick. We usually find murder victims at the end of hallways like these. I cannot believe Alexis lives here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Richard, Alexis and Pi have invited us for dinner. This is a big step for them. So let us not be judgmental.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Besides, remember the hovel you lived in in college?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The difference is I wasn’t shacking up with Pi.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, it’s nice that you’re keeping an open mind, dear.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi! You’re here! Come in! I’m so excited for you to see our place.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh … my. Your first place. Oh.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Hey, Mr. C!

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Welcome. And prepare yourself for some savory and sustainable dining.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, let me guess. There will be fruit.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: I’ll make a fruitarian out of you yet, Mr. C.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, here is a … um … little housewarming present. And it needs sunlight and there’s a little giftcard as well.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thank you, Gram. Well, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I think it’s adorable. I love what the two of you have done with this.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ve had lots of fun fixing it up. We were eating on a blanket on the floor and then we found this old door and set it up as a table.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And I found the chairs next to a restaurant dumpster.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dumpster chairs. That’s … … great.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well there’s nothing like la vie boheme to get the blood flowing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Be nice. A futon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, if you guys want something real to sit on I have an old couch in storage. I could just …

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Um … I don’t know, Mr. C. What color is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Free.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, we’re fine. We have everything we need.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So Pi, Alexis tells me that you have a new job.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: I do indeed. I’m tracking bee populations in the city for an NGO.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah ha.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: It’s a lot like the job I did in Costa Rica. We’re assessing the colony’s strength and numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re … counting bees?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Well, there’s a lot more to it than that, Mr. C, but yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’s a real job?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes, it’s a real job. Bees are vital to the food supply. It’s important work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, so long as it puts fruit on the table.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, speaking of the table, I am famished. Shall we dine?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Yes, let’s do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Needless to say, dinner was a disaster. But the real disaster is that Alexis has moved in with this guy. He’s just so wrong for her.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, she’ll figure it out. At least she’s not living in squalor. That’s good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s not good. I was hoping for squalor. I was counting on squalor. Because Alexis cannot last in squalor. I was just hoping this whole thing would blow over. She would see Pi for the ambition free hippie that he is. And now he’s morphed into some … new age crusader? It’s a though he’s turned being a charming man-child into a career.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now that doesn’t sound familiar, does it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What I need is a good murder so I can stop obsessing.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’ve got one for you, Castle. Victim is Susannah Richland, 28. Business card says she’s an accountant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does an accountant end up like this?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Freaky, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at those marks on her hands. They look like stigmata.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Like she’s posed in a suggested crucifixion.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Except the cause of death is probably that stab wound to the throat from a double edged blade, like a dagger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A dagger. Maybe this is some kind of ritualistic sacrifice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe the killer wanted to make it look like it was.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Note the lack of blood. I’d say that she was moved here but killed somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Might I suggest a sacrificial altar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you may not. Do we have a time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m thinking ten to midnight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, uh … I’ll start a canvass, start gathering security video. See if I can find someone that witnessed the body drop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and get ahold of the FBI. See if they have any other murders with the same MO.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Just got off the phone with Susannah’s boss. He knows of nothing in her life that would explain this. But he did say that she’d been acting odd lately and that she’d asked for a week off to handle a personal matter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he didn’t know what it was?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Neither did any of her coworkers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, contact her family and friends. Let’s see if they knew. Castle and I are going to go to her apartment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you know of any personal matters she might have been dealing with?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: No, but something was up. Last week she started keeping odd hours. Staying out late. It wasn’t like her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have visitors? Any men in her life?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Not that I ever saw. Be sure to lock up when you’re done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An apparently ordinary accountant brutally slain and ritually posed. All while tending to a personal matter shrouded in secrecy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not shrouded in secrecy. We just don’t know what it is yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, my version has more dramatic flair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s got a lot of books here on medieval history. Maybe her dark secret has something to do with the dark ages. That could explain the way we found her body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you might be on to something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at this. Religious icons and pagan symbols.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This fascination of hers is recent. All these books were checked out of the library three days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what does that have to do with our murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe I know the answer. The pentagram, the all seeing eye? Both of those are power objects in dark magic. All these elements – earth, air, fire, water, ether – all medieval symbols that are sometimes associated with satanic practices. Susannah was into the occult.

utterance.speaker: HENRY COLLINS
utterance.content: The occult? I know my cousin. No way was she mixed up with that kind of thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we found these symbols at her place, Mr. Collins. Along with some books on medieval history. Any idea why they’d be there?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: No. I mean, she was a history buff, but more American history, not that kind of thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did she have any … uh … enemies in her life, Mr. Collins? Any relationship issues?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Not that I know of. I just – I don’t understand who would do this to her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Maybe three weeks ago? I was her only family, so we’d get together for dinner every few months. But it’s strange. She, um … she actually called me last night. Out of the blue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what did she say?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: That she had something that she wanted to talk to me about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: I didn’t even get a chance to ask. She got interrupted or something, said she’d call me right back. But she never did. And now I know why.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the FBI doesn’t have any murders in the database that match this MO.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which leaves us with my theory. Our victim was dabbling with black magic and she conjured up a demon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she ran afoul of some obscure religious sect and they sacrificed her to their pagan deity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Making stuff up, just like you do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, because that’s my job. It’s your job to follow the evidence. You’re messing with the natural order of things.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys? There’s something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So our canvass couldn’t come up with anyone that witnessed the body dump. But Susannah had a Metro card in her pocket. So I had MTA run its history. Her card was swiped yesterday on an M3 bus. She got on at 8:45 near her apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where was she going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bus cam has her exiting at West 168th Street, Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s about a half mile from where her body was found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was she doing way up there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I checked traffic cam footage in a 10 block radius and I found Susannah crossing Saint Nicholas at West 173rd Street. And it looks like she had company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A monk?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Check out the timestamp. 10:05. Right in our time of death window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A posed body, mysterious medieval symbols, and now a murderous monk. It’s a real life Da Vinci Code.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we have any idea who this guy is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you who he is. He’s part of a brotherhood of assassins, chosen to guard an ancient secret.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stalking a woman obsessed with medieval symbols? This is what the evidence suggests.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we get a closer look at his face?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, he never turns his head.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, zoom in on his scalp. There. Do you see that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ritual markings. Left by some unholy initiation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re more like surgical scars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll see if I can look into a medical procedure that can cause those. Might help us ID him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m telling you, our monk, our victim, and these symbols are all connected. I’m betting Susannah Richland decoded these symbols and uncovered some dark, long-held secret - and paid for it with her life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, I agree that her recent interest in all things medieval might be relevant, but it doesn’t mean that she was killed in some baroque plot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah, I wouldn’t be too sure about that. Castle might be right about this Da Vinci Code thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - don’t ruin it. According to Susannah’s phone records, she made a call to a Professor Jason Byford at Hudson University the day before she died. And get this, he’s an expert in ancient languages and symbology.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just like Tom Hanks in the movie. It’s not a baroque plot. It’s a best-seller plot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, at the very least he should be able to tell us what Susannah was up to. Castle and I’ll go talk to him. In the meantime, I need you to go to the morgue. Lanie says she has something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ‘kay.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So I was finally able to identify the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought you said it was a dagger.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know what I said, but based on the curvature of the wound and the injuries to the neck, our victim was stabbed with a sword.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A sword?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes, a double-edged saber like this, with a hilt that left a crenellated bruising pattern on her neck.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Very old school.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I took a closer look at her hand injuries and I found something. There was ink residue in this wound on her palm. I was able to draw it up from the lower dermis. It looks like she drew this symbol on her hand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. I’ve gotta get this to Beckett. Head back to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: PROFESSOR JASON BYFORD
utterance.content: Yes, I met with Susannah. People often call with research questions, so I try to be helpful. She wanted to know what these symbols meant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you tell her?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: I said that it all depends. Some of these have existed for thousands of years. They signify different things to different cultures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are any of them tied to anything dangerous like cults?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Oh, a few, yes. But mostly these are associated with the Freemasons, which is why you see so many on buildings and icons in the US.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A lot of our founding fathers were Freemasons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I saw National Treasure.

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: As did I, sadly. Some odious factual errors. Though it is true that during the American Revolution, symbols like these were used as markers for war secrets and buried treasure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … … treasure?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Like the British gold left behind when they lost the war, or the missing half-dimes, the first coins minted by the US Treasury.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Professor, did Susannah ask you about this symbol?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Uh … I don’t believe so. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was killed last night, and we believe all these symbols are relevant.

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Um … there’s something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: She had this letter with her. She wanted to know if it was connected to the symbols. Now, I’d never seen anything quite like it so I uh … well, I snuck a picture of it while she wasn’t looking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “I, Theodore Rose, of New York City, a loyal Patriot of sound mind and body, do … do make this my last will and testament.”

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Theodore Rose was an 18th century stone mason of some renown, but it’s more than a will. Keep reading, here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “So I passed to them, still living, this key, which marks the way to our great secret enshrined within the city." And this letter is the key to finding it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did she get it?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: She didn’t say, but according to the date and seal it was written in 1798.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the Latin phrases? What do they mean?

utterance.speaker: BYFORD
utterance.content: Well, I translated some of them for her. They’re riddles of some kind. This one says, “ A world turns between the heavens and the ash heap.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re not riddles. They’re clues. Clues leading to some great Masonic treasure. And this last line could be why she was murdered. My Latin is pretty rusty, but I think that means, “peril and woe to him who follows this path with the dark heart”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So that pattern of scars on our monk’s dome was from a procedure called stereotactic brain surgery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, can that get us an ID? Because medical records are confidential.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Prison records aren’t. I took a shot that the guy did some time. Nineteen men in the system had this surgery, but only one had scars that were an exact match to the monk. Benjamin Wade. He got surgery to remove a tumor while doing a stretch at Greenhaven for an attempted murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hear that, Castle? Our suspect is an ex-con. A felonious monk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. I’ve got no current address on Benjamin Wade, but he did have an apartment in the Bronx before he got sent to the joint.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, check it out. See if anyone knows where he is now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t think anyone here can give us a line on Wade. Local police says this whole place has been taken over by squatters and crack dens.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look at this place. I’m going to get hepatitis just breathing the air in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is it. It’s where Wade used to live.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Home crap home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD, don’t move!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Benjamin Wade, you’re under arrest for murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Recognize her, Mr. Wade?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And this is you, stalking her shortly before she was killed. You care to explain?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he took a vow of silence. You know, silent but deadly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Assuming he’s a real monk.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: Actually, I am a monk. I just learned to think before I speak. I joined the Franciscan Order of Perpetual Hope after I left prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This monastery that you’re a part of, does it happen to be in Washington Heights? Because that’s exactly where we found Susannah Richland, and … given your record …

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: I’m not that guy anymore. After my brain tumor I had a spiritual awakening. Found a purpose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then what were you doing in a crack house?

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: Was tending to the lost. I wasn’t stalking this woman. I was – I was trying to protect her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Protect her?

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: I found her in the monastery chapel. She was kneeling by the prayer candles. Said the place was special to her family. So I left her to pray in peace. And this guy shows up. Brown long hair, glasses, he’s wearing this hat. Starts asking me questions about her. Wants to know what she’s doing there. He’s upset. He seems aggressive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Wade, that’s you following her. Not some other guy.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: I thought that he was going to go after her. So I followed her until she got into a cab and then I came back to the monastery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Okay. Describe the cab.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: It was a cab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: License plate? Medallion number.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: I don’t remember. It was a Prius, maybe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There are hundreds of those. A good storyteller uses details. That’s what sells the lie.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: It’s not a lie. There was an ad for Wicked on top of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wicked. That’s nice. It’s precise, Freudian, little detail. But still a lie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So here’s what’s not a lie. Just called the Franciscan order? Turns out Benjamin Wade really is a monk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And our murderer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now we just need to prove it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, you guys are on the same page about this guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not exactly. I think he’s guilty because of his contact with the victim, the stalking, and his history of violence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think he’s guilty because of his contact with the victim, the stalking, and his role in a sinister conspiracy involving Freemasons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’re really buying into that letter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe you aren’t! I did a little research into the author of our letter, Mr. Theodore Rose. Did you know he was a 33rd degree Master Mason?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So that makes him what, like a Freemason black belt?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Way better than that. He was a patriot spy. He wrote codes and cyphers during the American Revolution. Meaning, this letter could be the key to finding the great secret of the Masons, enshrined somewhere within the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why, because you want it to be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Partly. And because it’s the only story that makes sense. A shadowy brotherhood guarding Rose’s secret for all eternity. Susannah got too close, so they sent their monk assassin to kill her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, about that. Wade’s lawyer’s here. He says we need to charge his client or let him go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We don’t have enough to charge him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t we try to keep him until we do. Put Wade in with a sketch artist. Have him describe that guy that was supposedly stalking Susannah. That’ll buy Castle and I enough time to tear his alibi apart. And just to cover our bases, you look into that cab that Wade described.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? You want me to track down a cab off a banner ad for Wicked?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Impress me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, there are times I wish she’d stayed in DC.

utterance.speaker: BROTHER SILAS MORA
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective, but you’re wrong. Brother Benjamin was in his quarters at the time you say this young woman was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And can anyone else verify that?

utterance.speaker: MORA
utterance.content: At least seven other members of our order saw him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what exactly is the mission of your order?

utterance.speaker: MORA
utterance.content: To care for those in need. To live by and share the teachings of Christ.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you left out the part about protecting a great secret.

utterance.speaker: MORA
utterance.content: I’m afraid I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you?

utterance.speaker: MORA
utterance.content: No, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … thank you … so much for your time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for your time? That’s it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, until we get the statements from the other seven witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, they’re all going to tell you the same thing. Don’t you see? These monks, they’re in it up to their hoods. Unless … unless they’re not protecting a great secret and they’re actually trying to find it, too. Because, like the Ark of the Covenant, it is a source of ultimate power.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, these monks took vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience. I don’t see them trying to take over the world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: World.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Theodore Rose’s letter. There’s that one clue in Latin. Uh … … “the world turns between the heavens and ash heap”. In Latin the word for ash heap also means altar. The heavens are depicted in that stained glass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the altar is right underneath it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the clues led her to this chapel. But why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The prayer candles. So this must be where Wade said he found Susannah kneeling. Castle, look. There’s something carved in that base stone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the symbol she drew on her hand. So these other clues …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Must lead to other places where the symbols are hidden. But what are they for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen to this. “For Gods and men alike doth lame Hephaestus strike.” I know what that means. I know where that is!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Hephaestus was the Greek God of blacksmiths. His forge was in Mount Etna. There’s a blacksmith shop right here in lower Manhattan called Etna’s Forge. It’s been there since the 1700s. I know because I was there with … Alexis. It was a field trip. Third grade. But that’s – that’s gotta be it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our victim was killed with a sword. If there’s an old blacksmith’s shop that could be our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A clue trail to a Freemason secret the people would kill for. This case just keeps getting better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So maybe what Benjamin Wade actually did that night was follow Susannah to this blacksmith’s shop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we don’t even know if she was here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she was here, all right. On the verge of solving the puzzle when her life was cut tragically short. This is the place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I never knew this was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. This is incredible. Shouldn’t there be a docent or some sweaty guy hammering metal standing around?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Hello? Is there a smithy here about? We have travelled many a mile – – is this annoying you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. You know what? I’m going to check in back. Why don’t you look around here. If this is our crime scene there might be signs of a struggle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oooh. Have it, want it, need it, got it, need it.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: You should not have come here looking for the sign, for only death awaits you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well now, that wouldn’t happen to be a double edged saber with a crenellated hilt, now would it?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: You have trespassed into secrets beyond your comprehension. You will pay with your life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay, but just … before you kill me there’s one thing you should know.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: And what is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am really good at this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not so bad yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you and what do you know about the last will of Theodore Rose?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: For two hundred years my people have guarded the secret. It’ll go with me to my grave. And yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now who are you?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: It’s not important who I am. The win is yours. The sign shall be revealed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the symbol from Susannah’s board. She was here. It was you. You’re the one who killed her.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Whoa, wait a minute. You won, man. You can put the sword down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not until you tell me who you are and why you killed Susannah Richland. Beckett!

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I think there’s been some kind of mistake here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. No mistake. Susannah was stabbed through the throat with a double edged saber. By you or one of your people.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m a little lost here. Did they change the script? ‘cause if they did, they didn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Script. What script?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: The scavenger hunt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A scavenger hunt? So the clues? The symbol? It’s all just a game?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: A fundraiser. For the New York Historical Institute. The clues lead to historic buildings where the players collect these old symbols. They hire actors like me to interact with the contestants. I usually work Renaissance Faires.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was this woman one of your contestants?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Yeah. She came through here … … a couple days ago. She was killed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, with a saber almost exactly like the one you were using.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: That was a stunt weapon. It’s harmless. They all are. I didn’t kill anybody. I’m just an actor. I wasn’t even working here last night. Look, please. Call the New York Historical Institute. Talk to Nolan Burns, the director. This is all just a game.

utterance.speaker: NOLAN BURNS
utterance.content: Of course it was just a game. Every year more and more historic New York buildings are torn down. And as director of the Historical Institute I was looking for a fun way to raise awareness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Burns, these symbols that Susannah Richland took pictures of, are those also a part of the game?

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Yes, these are all symbols I used in the game. Looks like she found them all. She might have won.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it possible that someone could have killed her to get a competitive edge?

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: The prize money is $2500. Some of the contestants spent more than that in travel expenses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could these symbols mean something else? Something dangerous?

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Not that I’m aware of. I do know they can be found on buildings dating as far back as the 1700s, which is why I used them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just – our victim had this letter on her, from an 18th century Freemason named Theodore Rose. In it he speaks of a great hidden secret.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: To be enshrined in the city. The letter was part of the game. We had it handwritten on parchment. One for each contestant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Rose is real. He had a penchant for clues and cyphers.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Exactly. He brought some authenticity. And the fact that he was a Freemason and a friend of George Washington’s made Rose the perfect person on whom to base the game. So I drew from his writings and the rest I pulled from Freemason history. But none of this is real. I don’t see how any of this would lead to someone’s death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Regardless, I’m going to need the names of all of the contestants.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: You’d have to check with the event planning company, Games Ultra. They handled the registration.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe all this time it was all just make believe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you didn’t really believe that this was going to lead to some great Freemason treasure, did you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Of course not. That would be foolish. Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to go home to wallow in what is perhaps the most disappointing day of my crime solving career.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll come by later and try to cheer you up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we get the list of contestants from Games Ultra?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep, and the contestant applications had to include a photo. Take a look at this dude.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, check out the sketch that our monk gave us of the guy that he says was following Susannah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the same guy. Okay, so … what do we know about Tom Stevens?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, his name and address are bogus. Everything on the application is. None of this information is real.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He has to be the guy who killed her. He was at the monastery. And why else would he sign up with a fake name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, his name might be fake, but his money real. And there you go. He paid with a check. If we can trace that payment …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We might be able to ID him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, see where Games Ultra keeps their accounts and hit that bank first thing in the morning. I want this guy found.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard? Richard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What is all this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just some … game.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, you might want to pay attention to the real world for a moment. Alexis is furious with you over your behavior at dinner the other night and I must say, I agree.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, it wasn’t that bad.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You insulted her apartment, you made fun of her boyfriend’s career –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, he’s counting bees.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, and it is important to him, as Alexis is important to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just don’t even understand. Why is she even with him?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: This is what she wants. Now will she want it next week or next month? Who knows? But this is what she wants today, and if you want her to be a part of her life, then you are going to have to change your point of view.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Course I’m right. Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Point of view.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t a game. This isn’t a game at all.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No luck. The bank says Mr. Stevens paid with a check, but it was a cashier’s check. There’s no way to trace it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hiding his identity, following our victim just before she died. This had gotta be our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. I finally tracked down that cab that our victim got into. The one with the banner ad for Wicked on top? At first I had to call the theater where Wicked was playing. They directed me to a PR firm who then sent me to an ad agency who sells space on the top of cabs, five cabs had –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you talk to the cabbie or not?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, I did. The cabbie confirmed that he picked up Susannah in Washington Heights at 10:10PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our monk was telling the truth. Okay, where did the cabbie take her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s the odd part. He didn’t take her anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Susannah just had him drive around the neighborhood for forty-five minutes and then dropped her back off at the chapel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. Why would she go back there the same night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you why. Because Susannah realized it wasn’t just a game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, please don’t tell me that you’re still on –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. Just listen. Burns told us that he based the game on some of the writings of Theodore Rose. Now, what if Rose’s clues were real and actually lead somewhere? What if Susannah figured that out? Here are all our symbols. They didn’t seem to relate to each other, until you add this one. The one Susannah drew on her hand. The one she found at the chapel the night she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They all fit together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The final piece. Without it the other didn’t fit. That’s why the killer scraped it off her hand. He didn’t want her or anyone else to be able to figure it out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so the pieces fit together. What do they mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But does this shape look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes it does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Amazing, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. But what does it mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It means that this isn’t part of any game. All those symbols put together indicate this carving. It has to have some kind of significance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle … look at this. Each one of these symbols has a small letter next to it. R … O … S … I.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rosi? Maybe it’s supposed to be his name: Rose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No … that’s an I. Um … maybe it’s roi, like French for king? Or soir for evening …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, wait. Earth, air, water, fire, ether in the center. In Medieval alchemy these are the five elements that make up the universe, but there’s an order of importance: earth, air, water, fire. Put the letters in that order it’s O … R … I … S. Oris. Latin for mouth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just kidding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe you fell for that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There is something in here, though. Hang on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Susannah was here. This is our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s our murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at this. These marks are fresh. Someone was trying to get inside it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Susannah must have come to the chapel that night and figured out how to get in here, just like we did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except the killer found her before she was able to open the sarcophagus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you think’s inside?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but someone thought it was worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Just like everything else we’ve been doing, we need to solve a clue to open it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at the world. It’s just like the one in the stained glass above the altar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “The world spins between the heavens and the ash heap.” … ashes to ashes. The coffin could be the ash heap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means … … there. Those are our heavens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The world turns.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 1792. These are the half-dimes Professor Byford just told us about. These are the first coins minted by the US Treasury. These are worth a fortune!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now we have our motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just one of these went for auction last year. 1.5 million dollars. There’s gotta be a thousand in here. Do you have any idea what that’s worth? I just told you what it’s worth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I had to guess, I’d say something bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, put the bag of coins back in the coffin. Maybe it’ll open up the door again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rats. This is not my idea of going to the chapel with you. You have a cell signal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it doesn’t look like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, the letter was right. “Peril and woe to him who follows this path of dark heart.” This is it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we’re not going to die in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You saw how thick those walls were. They’re made of stone. We can yell and scream all day long. No one’s going to hear. It’s not like they stocked up this place with supplies. And what’s going to happen when we get tired of eating candle wax?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, we’re going to get out of here. There has to be a way out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. You know what? You’re right. This is just Theodore Rose testing us. There’s got to be another clue. Another puzzle. Something to do with his name. What if – what if it’s an anagram?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Theodore Rose … is … head or toes. No. Theodore Rose … he do rooster. That’s inappropriate. Okay, Theodore Rose, Theodore Rose. Deer shot oreo. Oh, they didn’t have Oreos in the 1700s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, there might be another way out of here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m all ears.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Susannah’s killer knows that the half-dimes are still in here. Eventually he’s going to have to come back to get them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He must be someone who knew they existed in the first place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone who knew all of this was real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who better than the person who wanted everyone to think this was just a game? Nolan Burns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nolan Burns. The director of the Historical Institute. Castle, I’ve got bars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finally.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: S’up, Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, you need to get to the chapel now. And tell Ryan to pick up Nolan Burns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Burns, you left out a few details the last time we spoke.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: I don’t know what you mean.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: You found them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it wasn’t just a game.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: No. That letter we gave the contestants was based on an actual letter I found hidden in a building I was renovating. I tried to follow the clues myself, but I couldn’t solve them all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You set up a scavenger hunt to solve clues through crowdsourcing.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: I never thought anyone would get hurt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not hurt, Burns. Murdered.

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Yeah, but not by me. I swear. I told you. I was at home with my family the night she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You also told me that you didn’t know Susannah. I spoke with your assistant. You met with her three months ago. How did you fail to mention that?

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Because I knew how it would look!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And now it looks even worse. Now, why did you meet with her?

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Because I hoped she could shed some light on the Rose family history. You know, something that might help solve that last clue. But that was it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Go back. Susannah was an accountant. Why would she know anything about the Rose family?

utterance.speaker: BURNS
utterance.content: Because. She was a direct descendant of Theodore Rose. The legend of the missing half-dimes was family lore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Family lore.

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Hey. They said you found something out about my cousin’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We did. We just have to go over a few things first. Now according to her phone records, she called you more frequently over the last few months. Is there any reason why?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: I got the feeling she was lonely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did she ever mention Theodore Rose?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: No. Why would she?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re familiar with the lore. The missing half-dimes.

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. It was a big family myth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except it wasn’t. Susannah actually located the coins. They were in a hidden crypt. That’s where she was killed.

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: That’s terrible. Do you know who did it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Most likely someone who knew was she was looking for. CSU found two sets of DNA in that crypt. One was from Susannah, one was from her killer. Now, on a hunch I had them compare the two. And the results indicate that Susannah and her killer were related.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: CSU also found a synthetic hair found in a wig, not unlike this one. You signed up for the game under a false name. You used a disguise so you could track her progress. It’s over, Henry. We know it’s you.

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: My mom’s in assisted living. I work hard but I barely get by. Those half-dimes were going to change my life. But Susannah said that she was going to find them and then just give them all away. Said they were part of history. That they belonged to the people. She called me that night with the good news. And I tried to talk her out of it one last time. We argued. And the next thing I knew …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I was looking through the records and I found out there have been several Rose family weddings in that chapel. Susannah had even been there once, years ago. She must have remembered seeing that stained glass window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s how she was able to figure out that last clue when no one else could.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And why Henry scraped it off her hand. So he could be the only one to ever find it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s going to happen to the half-dimes?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, they were found in the chapel, so they belong to the monastery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Put the monks' vow of poverty to the test.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, they’ve already passed that with flying colors. Because of the historical significance of the coins they’re donating them to the Met.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. You know –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, here we go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - it’s believed that George Washington had those half-dimes minted for Martha Washington’s silver. Back then, before the Revolution, it was illegal for anyone but a king to make money. So those coins were worth a lot more than just their silver. They were actually more of a declaration of independence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, it’s right that they’re going back to the people. Just like Susannah wanted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of independence… I’ve gotta go see Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. Can I come in?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We can talk here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I’m … sorry. About how I acted.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Being sorry isn’t enough, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then what can I do? What can I do to make this right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Do you know I found out you had proposed to Beckett? Over the phone, with Gram. While I was in Costa Rica.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is about Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. But I was hurt you didn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I was going to tell you. It just … it just happened.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know it did. And I don’t know if it’s a good idea or if she’s really the one, but you know what? I accept it. You know why? Because she makes you happy. The same way Pi makes me happy. All I want is the same thing I’m giving you. Acceptance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay then. I accept him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No you don’t. Because it’s not about what you say, it’s about what’s inside. I know it’s there now and I don’t want Pi to feel that from you. And I don’t want to feel that, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look … I’ll work on it. I will. In the meantime, how about we go out for some makeup ice cream, okay? My treat.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. I need time to stop being mad. And you need time to figure out a way to be okay with this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll see you later, Dad.
